Unlike the results shown in an actual performance record, these results do not represent actual trading. For example, the ability to withstand losses or to adhere to a particular trading program in spite of trading losses are material points which can also adversely affect actual trading results. There are numerous other factors related to the markets in general or to the implementation of any specific trading program, which cannot be fully accounted for in the preparation of hypothetical performance results and all of which can adversely affect actual trading results.

      <div class="comp-faq-list">
       <div class="comp-faq-list__side">
        <div class="c2-faq-item" data-accordion-item="">
         <div class="c2-faq-item__question" data-accordion-head="">
          <h3>
           Do I need a live account to manage a strategy?
           <span data-question="trade-leader">
           </span>
          </h3>
         </div>
         <div class="c2-faq-item__answer text-editor" data-accordion-body="">
          <p>
           You do not need a live (â€œreal-moneyâ€) brokerage account to manage a trading strategy on Collective2. However, if you
           <span style="text-decoration: underline;">
            <em>
             do
            </em>
           </span>
           have a live brokerage account at a compatible broker (such as Interactive Brokers, OptionsHouse, Gain Capital, or others), you can use our BrokerTransmit technology to â€œrun your strategyâ€ (submit buy and sell signals) by simply trading in your broker account, as you normally do.
          </p>
          <p>
           If you donâ€™t have a live broker account, or choose not to connect to us usingÂ BrokerTransmit, you can use C2 QuickTrade to enter your trades. C2 QuickTrade is a web-based trade-entry screen. If youâ€™ve ever used an online broker, the experience will be similar.
          </p>
          <p>
           Alternately, you can use one of our connectors to popular platforms such as TradeStation, NinjaTrader, MetaTrader, or MultiCharts.
          </p>
          <p>
           Or you can use our API. Or you can use Seetu, our strategy-development and backtesting environment. In other words, whatever floats your boat.
          </p>
         </div>
        </div>
        <div class="c2-faq-item" data-accordion-item="">
         <div class="c2-faq-item__question" data-accordion-head="">
          <h3>
           How much money can I make?
           <span data-question="trade-leader">
           </span>
          </h3>
         </div>
         <div class="c2-faq-item__answer text-editor" data-accordion-body="">
          <p>
           With over
           <span class="forceltr">
            103,000
           </span>
           registered users, and hundreds of millions of dollars of automated transactions flowing through our platform each week, Collective2 is the worldâ€™s dominant open trading strategy platform.* If your strategy performs well at C2,Â chances are good that you will make money.
          </p>
          <p>
           How much? That obviously depends on your strategy, and how well it performs, but we can give you some benchmarks. The highest-grossing strategy on C2 has earned over a half-million dollars. Other strategies hover aroundÂ the $100,000 dollars revenue level. And quite a few good strategies cluster around the $20,000 to $30,000 level.
          </p>
          <p>
           <span style="font-size: 12px;">
            * â€œThe worldâ€™s dominant open trading strategy platformâ€ â€“ based on analysis of available, published revenue and a user statistics for private companies. Also based onÂ the
            <span style="text-decoration: underline;">
             completely objective
            </span>
            opinion of our mothers.
           </span>
          </p>
         </div>
        </div>
        <div class="c2-faq-item" data-accordion-item="">
         <div class="c2-faq-item__question" data-accordion-head="">
          <h3>
           How do I price my subscription?
           <span data-question="trade-leader">
           </span>
          </h3>
         </div>
         <div class="c2-faq-item__answer text-editor" data-accordion-body="">
          <p>
           You can charge subscribers any amount you like, but the â€œsweet spotâ€ seems to be between the $49 and $199 monthly price point.Â Most strategies offer free trial periods.
          </p>
          <p>
           Another factor to consider is the amount of capital required to follow your strategy. When you beginÂ a strategy on Collective2, youâ€™ll be asked to choose itsÂ starting â€œModel Accountâ€ size. When choosing Model Account size, make sure you take into account the margin needed, position sizing, and typical drawdown. Strategies that require more than $50,000 may be less popular than those that can be followed with a smaller capital amount.
          </p>
         </div>
        </div>
        <div class="c2-faq-item" data-accordion-item="">
         <div class="c2-faq-item__question" data-accordion-head="">
          <h3>
           What is AutoTrading? How much does it cost?
           <span data-question="investor">
           </span>
          </h3>
         </div>
         <div class="c2-faq-item__answer text-editor" data-accordion-body="">
          <p>
           If you find a trading strategy that you like (or two strategies, or threeâ€¦), you will first â€œsubscribeâ€ to it. This means you can receive emails or instant messages each time a buy or sell is published by the strategy.
          </p>
          <p>
           Of course, itâ€™s a bitÂ of a drag, to have to jump like a trained monkey every time your phone dings and a trade signal arrives. Thatâ€™s where AutoTrade comes in.
          </p>
          <p>
           If you choose our AutoTrade technology, every time a buy or sell signal is published, aÂ trade will beÂ placed in your brokerage accountâ€¦ automatically.
          </p>
          <p>
           Hereâ€™s the cool part. Even though itâ€™s called â€œAutoTrade,â€ the amount of its
           <em>
            â€œautoâ€-ness
           </em>
           is up to you. You stay inÂ control. Start and stop trading whenever you like.Â Tell the software which kind of things to trade, and which kind of things
           <em>
            not
           </em>
           to trade (For example: â€œYes, stocksâ€¦ but no options.â€). Tell the software how big or small to make your trades. You can even specify your own customized stop-losses
           <span style="color: #800000;">
            *
           </span>
           or profit targets. And if you see a trade that you absolutely, positively
           <em>
            love
           </em>
           , you can increase its size, on the fly. Similarly, if you see a real stinker, you can close that specificÂ trade earlyâ€¦ even before the strategy recommendsâ€¦Â even while allowing the strategy to continue trading other things.
          </p>
          <p>
           So, yeah, itâ€™s â€œautomatic,â€ but you can keep control.
          </p>
          <p>
           C2 AutoTrade technology runs on our servers. It costs $99 per month to use the technology. This is a monthly software fee. This cost does not vary, regardless of how large is your broker account, and regardless of how often you trade.
          </p>
          <p>
           Each strategy to which you subscribe sets its own monthly subscription price. These fees usually range between $20 â€“ $200 per month. Many strategies offer free trial periods.
          </p>
          <p>
           <em>
            <span style="font-size: 12px;">
             <span style="font-size: 18px; color: #800000;">
              *
             </span>
             â€œStop Lossesâ€ may not limit losses in all market conditions.
            </span>
           </em>
          </p>
         </div>
        </div>
        <div class="c2-faq-item" data-accordion-item="">
         <div class="c2-faq-item__question" data-accordion-head="">
          <h3>
           Can I subscribe and follow more than one strategy
           <br/>
           at a time?
           <span data-question="investor">
           </span>
          </h3>
         </div>
         <div class="c2-faq-item__answer text-editor" data-accordion-body="">
          <p>
           Yep, you sure can, provided your account has enough capital. A good way to experience the results of multiple strategies as a â€˜portfolioâ€™ is to select a few in the Simulated Broker Account account provided on Collective2. You can follow trade signals for any system that has a free-trial period.
          </p>
         </div>
        </div>
        <div class="c2-faq-item" data-accordion-item="">
         <div class="c2-faq-item__question" data-accordion-head="">
          <h3>
           What brokers are available to autotrade Collective2 strategies?
           <span data-question="investor">
           </span>
          </h3>
         </div>
         <div class="c2-faq-item__answer text-editor" data-accordion-body="">
          <p>
           You can find a list of
           <a href="https://trade.collective2.com/compatible-brokers/" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
            compatible brokers
           </a>
           that can receive autotrade signals from Collective2 here. We are continually updating this list.
          </p>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="comp-faq-list__side">
        <div class="c2-faq-item" data-accordion-item="">
         <div class="c2-faq-item__question" data-accordion-head="">
          <h3>
           Do I need to be licensed or registered?
           <span data-question="trade-leader">
           </span>
          </h3>
         </div>
         <div class="c2-faq-item__answer text-editor" data-accordion-body="">
          <p>
           If you are an U.S.Â person, the short answer is:
           <u>
            No
           </u>
           , you do not need to register with any government agency, or pass any kind of test, or have a license in order to publish trading signals.Â However,
           <a href="https://support.collective2.com/hc/en-us/articles/203243230-Do-I-need-to-register-with-the-CFTC-or-the-SEC-in-order-to-sell-my-trading-advice-Do-I-need-some-kind-of-license-to-start-a-trading-system-">
            <u>
             you must be aware of certain restrictions
            </u>
            .
           </a>
           The most important restriction is this: You cannot provide individualized advice to clients. That is, you cannot offer different advice to different clients based on their individual financial situations.
          </p>
          <p>
           If you are not a U.S. person, please check with a local attorney regarding the restrictionsÂ your government imposesÂ upon you. Happily, we can report that Collective2 works with Trade Leaders all over the world, including the USA, Europe, the Middle East, China, Hong Kong, Singapore, North and South America, and Oceana.
          </p>
         </div>
        </div>
        <div class="c2-faq-item" data-accordion-item="">
         <div class="c2-faq-item__question" data-accordion-head="">
          <h3>
           How do I get paid?
           <span data-question="trade-leader">
           </span>
          </h3>
         </div>
         <div class="c2-faq-item__answer text-editor" data-accordion-body="">
          <p>
           Once you start signing up subscribers, weâ€™ll take care of all the transaction processing. We pay Trade Leaders (strategy managers) 70% of any subscriptions you collect through Collective2. Charge whatever youâ€™d like for access to your strategy.
          </p>
          <p>
           Everything is included:
          </p>
          <ul>
           <li>
            Offer Autotrading to subscribers.
            <b>
             Included.
            </b>
           </li>
           <li>
            Broadcast signals via email, Instant Messenger, or cell phone.
            <b>
             Included.
            </b>
           </li>
           <li>
            Private forum for your subscribers.
            <b>
             Included.
            </b>
           </li>
          </ul>
         </div>
        </div>
        <div class="c2-faq-item" data-accordion-item="">
         <div class="c2-faq-item__question" data-accordion-head="">
          <h3>
           How do I get my trade signals into Collective2?
           <span data-question="trade-leader">
           </span>
          </h3>
         </div>
         <div class="c2-faq-item__answer text-editor" data-accordion-body="">
          <p>
           To â€œmanage a strategyâ€ here on Collective2, youâ€™ll need to submit buy and sell signals. That means: when itâ€™s time to buy something, you need to tell us, â€œBuy now.â€ When itâ€™s time to sell, youâ€™ll need to tell us, â€œSell now.â€
          </p>
          <p>
           The easiest way toÂ do this is toÂ type your buy and sell signals directly into our web site using C2 QuickTrade. C2 QuickTrade is a web page that looks like an online broker. When you type in your trade, C2 â€œpublishesâ€ it simultaneously to all subscribers.
          </p>
          <p>
           Alternately, if you have a live broker account at a C2-compatible broker, you can use BrokerTransmit technology, which automatically beams your trading activity into your C2 Model Account. (From there, all your subscribers will receive your published buy / sell instruction simultaneously.)
          </p>
          <p>
           Or, you can explore advancedÂ choices, which include our C2 API, email, platform connectors (NinjaTrader, MT4, TradeStation), or programming your strategy using our Seetu language (pronounced
           <em>
            SEE
           </em>
           -too).
          </p>
         </div>
        </div>
        <div class="c2-faq-item" data-accordion-item="">
         <div class="c2-faq-item__question" data-accordion-head="">
          <h3>
           Can I subscribe and follow C2 strategies in a retirement account (IRA)?
           <span data-question="investor">
           </span>
          </h3>
         </div>
         <div class="c2-faq-item__answer text-editor" data-accordion-body="">
          <p>
           Yes. Stock and stock option systems can be traded in most traditional IRA accounts. Futures systems often require an alternative investment custodian. You can check with your broker for a recommendation of companies that allow for self-directed accounts that can participate in non-traditional assets.
          </p>
         </div>
        </div>
        <div class="c2-faq-item" data-accordion-item="">
         <div class="c2-faq-item__question" data-accordion-head="">
          <h3>
           Can strategy subscription fees be deducted directly from my brokerage account instead of a credit card authorization?
           <span data-question="investor">
           </span>
          </h3>
         </div>
         <div class="c2-faq-item__answer text-editor" data-accordion-body="">
          <p>
           Weâ€™re working on that and it may be available for some brokers in the future. For now, though, subscription fees can only be paid via credit card on file for your C2 account.
          </p>
         </div>
        </div>
        <div class="c2-faq-item" data-accordion-item="">
         <div class="c2-faq-item__question" data-accordion-head="">
          <h3>
           I don't see my broker in the list of available choices. What gives?
           <span data-question="investor">
           </span>
          </h3>
         </div>
         <div class="c2-faq-item__answer text-editor" data-accordion-body="">
          <p>

And we do work with quite a few powerful firms, any one ofÂ which could squash us like a bug on their windshield â€” firms like Interactive Brokers, OptionsHouse, FXCM, Gain Capital, NinjaTrader, Dorman, AMP, and many others.      <p>

     <p>
      <span style="color: #000000; font-size: 16px;">

     </p>
     <p>
      <span style="color: #000000; font-size: 16px;">
       Remember: trading is risky. You can lose money.Â Past results are not necessarily indicative of future results.
      </span>
     </p>
     <p>
      <span style="font-size: 16px;">
       <strong>
        <span style="color: #000000;">
         Futures and forex trading is not appropriate for everyone.
        </span>
       </strong>
      </span>
     </p>
     <p>
      <span style="color: #000000; font-size: 16px;">
       <strong>
        These results are based on simulated or hypothetical performance results that have certain inherent limitations.
       </strong>
       Unlike the results shown in an actual performance record, these results do not represent actual trading. Also, because these trades have not actually been executed, these results may have under-or over-compensated for the impact, if any, of certain market factors, such as lack of liquidity. Simulated or hypothetical trading programs in general are also subject to the fact that they are designed with the benefit of hindsight. No representation is being made that any account will or is likely to achieve profits or losses similar to these being shown. In addition, hypothetical trading does not involve financial risk, and no hypothetical trading record can completely account for the impact of financial risk in actual trading. For example, the ability to withstand losses or to adhere to a particular trading program in spite of trading losses are material points which can also adversely affect actual trading results.Â There are numerous other factors related to the markets in general or to the implementation of any specific trading program, which cannot be fully accounted for in the preparation of hypothetical performance results and all of which can adversely affect actual trading results. You may be interested to learn more technical details about
       <a href="https://trade.collective2.com/how-we-calculate-results/" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
        <span style="color: #fb7401;">
         how Collective2 calculates the hypothetical results
        </span>
       </a>
       you see on this web site.
      </span>
     </p>
     <p>
      <span style="color: #000000; font-size: 16px;">
       <b>
        Material assumptions and methods used when calculating results
       </b>
      </span>
     </p>
     <p>
      <span style="color: #000000; font-size: 16px;">
       The following are material assumptions used when calculating any hypothetical monthly results that appear on our web site.
      </span>
     </p>
     <ul style="margin-left: 30px; margin-right: 30px;">
      <li style="margin-bottom: 15px;">
       <span style="color: #000000; font-size: 14px;">
        <b>
         Profits are reinvested.
        </b>
        We assume profits (when there are profits) are reinvested in the trading strategy.
       </span>
      </li>
      <li style="margin-bottom: 15px;">
       <span style="color: #000000; font-size: 14px;">
        <b>
         Starting investment size.
        </b>
        For any trading strategy on our site, hypothetical results are based on the assumption that you invested the starting amount shown on the strategyâ€™s performance chart. In some cases, nominal dollar amounts on the equity chart have been re-scaled downward to make current go-forward trading sizes more manageable. In these cases, it may not have been possible to trade the strategy historically at the equity levels shown on the chart, and a higher minimum capital was required in the past.
       </span>
      </li>
      <li style="margin-bottom: 15px;">
       <span style="color: #000000; font-size: 14px;">
        <b>
         All fees are included.
        </b>
        When calculating cumulative returns, we try to estimate and include all the fees a typical trader incurs when AutoTrading using AutoTrade technology. This includes the subscription cost of the strategy, plus any per-trade AutoTrade fees, plus estimated broker commissions if any.
       </span>
      </li>
      <li style="margin-bottom: 15px;">
       <span style="color: #000000; font-size: 14px;">
        <b>
         â€œMax Drawdownâ€ Calculation Method.
        </b>
        We calculate the
        <i>
         Max Drawdown
        </i>
        statistic as follows. Our computer software looks at the equity chart of the system in question and finds the largest percentage amount that the equity chart ever declines from a local â€œpeakâ€ to a subsequent point in time (thus this is formally called â€œMaximum Peak to Valley Drawdown.â€) While this is useful information when evaluating trading systems, you should keep in mind that past performance does not guarantee future results. Therefore, future drawdowns may be larger than the historical maximum drawdowns you see here.
       </span>
      </li>
     </ul>
     <p>
      <span style="font-size: 16px;">
       <strong>
        <span style="color: #000000;">
         What we mean
        </span>
       </strong>
      </span>
     </p>
     <p>
      <span style="color: #000000; font-size: 16px;">
       *

       </strong>
       Strategy fees vary and are set by the individual trade leader (system manager). These fees range from $20-$200+/month and can be found on the System Summary page on the Collective2 application. Autotrade fees are $49/month. Brokerage commissions and structures are determined by the individual brokers. Rates are published on the brokersâ€™ sites.
